Reviews.Title: Easy setup and excellent software & app compatibility
Reviews.Author: C. Young "clay2young"
Reviews.Content: Good image, easy installation. Completely compatibles with all software I am using on PCs, iPhones and iPads. Also have the wired version. Just wish it was less bulky, but. Knew from description what the size was going to be., so can't dock them a star for that.

Reviews.Title: Easy to set up
Reviews.Author: Daniel Jensen
Reviews.Content: We've got this set up to monitor and works as intended.  Easy set up and nice app for the smart phone user too.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: RoMeR
Reviews.Content: With the latest firmware, works pretty well.  With older firmware, it would not work on Macs with quicktime ( the fast high resolution camera modes. )  But with the latest firmware, all is well.  Only issues I have with it are the controls for PTZ are sluggish to respond and buffer your clicks so clicking a lot results in endless panning.  Advanced features like motion detection and movie capture and transfer didn't work when I tried to play with them, but I didn't spend much time with these features as they are not something I was planning on using.  Big plus is better video quality and frame rates - which is the reason I bought it.Overall good camera considering the market and other cameras in this price range.

Reviews.Title: Great Image, Great Price
Reviews.Author: John Lindsay
Reviews.Content: This camera is fantastic. I have two - one for my main floor in my house, and another in my garage. The night image is unbelievable - very clear, and very bright. As long as you do not have any kind of reflective surface near the IR LEDs at night (like a close wall or window) the image will be great.The app for the phone works very well too - I just wish they would allow the "presets" in there as well, as panning and tilting over 3G can get a little slow.

Reviews.Title: Indoor Camera
Reviews.Author: Frank1040
Reviews.Content: Works well and is easy to set up on home wi fi network.  But to review camera remotely is harder to accomplish.  Ability to email video etc. has been easy to accomplish.  Not completely happy with setting up remote viewing of the camera.

Reviews.Title: The camara is good
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: I like it, but the configuration must be more easy. I want to see it by cell phone but still in SecurePro Mobile isn't configurate it.

Reviews.Title: Great product good resolution
Reviews.Author: Scott Gilbert "Scott02127"
Reviews.Content: No so easy to setup if you don't have an open wifi (I have secured ), but plugged it into Ethernet and managed to make the changes to get it to work on the wifi. If it were not for the setup and lack of instructions to get you through the more difficult parts like configuring your home router to send the proper ports back the correct IP, etc. I would have given it 5 stars. I am a network engineer so it was not difficult for me, but others may have to do some research, to access it from outside your home network.Great quality of image, and love the camera. It even recovered from a power hit, that jumbled the image until we could power cycle it. Works great on LAN and WLAN. This is the one WITHOUT the IR LEDs. My wife uses it to look out our window at the bird feeders remotely, so at night the IR LEDs would just reflect off the widows, so we are happier with this model.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera works well
Reviews.Author: Frederick W. Hartman
Reviews.Content: I have no problems. Nice picture in bright light.night vision works well and does cover area within view.So far I have purchased two of these and both have worked well

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: amccom
Reviews.Content: Automatic email warnings are perfect.  Of course darkness photos are black and white.Using in a short range and pleased with performance.  Can access from internet.  Getting it up was difficult because of instructions assuming user is internet genuis.  But once up it has been running and running.  Remote usage is great.

Reviews.Title: Good value but pan/tilt lacking in web interface
Reviews.Author: B. Pearce
Reviews.Content: [Pan/Tilt]- Terrible Pan/Tilt controls in web interface.  You can move the camera a tiny bit at a time in 8 directions, or send it to the home position.  No preset positions in the web interface except "Home".  At the very least they should have supported keyboard input.+ Higher than average Pan/Tilt speed.  Useful if you have good compatible 3rd party software.* I didn't try the included offical PC software, which might be better (I doubt it, though!).* I reverse engineered how the pan/tilt commands are sent. The camera can accept commands to move MUCH farther than the web interface exposes.  Surely there is some 3rd party software out there that can take advantage of this and take some of the pain out of moving the camera.[Image Quality]+ 1280x800 resolution at 30 frames per second (H.264 encoding).  This is slightly taller than 720p video.+ Low latency video (which is crucial for Pan/Tilt cameras).+ Automatic and/or manual day/night mode with built-in Infrared emitters.+ Supports configurable-resolution jpeg captures (~5 frames per second at native resolution).  Great for compatibility with simpler or older programs and for publishing to web sites.[Zoom]- What zoom?  All zoom is digital zoom, which your browser can do better anyway using its own zoom controls.[Audio]+ It has a built-in microphone.+ It has a line-out jack so speakers can be plugged in (untested)[Other Notes]I did not try the built-in motion detection.

Reviews.Title: Excellent for the price
Reviews.Author: S. Kelley "Your government, now with more Orw...
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is fine (not stellar).  Sound is OK in a small room (get worse in a larger more echo-y space).  Since the next jumo up in quality is to the $2000 level, these are a good deal. Too bad you must running Windows and IE to view them though.

Reviews.Title: Not impressed
Reviews.Author: L. K. Rd "Lost Soul, Found"
Reviews.Content: I cannot recommend this camera unless it will never be accessed by a Mac user. So far I've had a ticket in for over a month asking why Macs can not view either MPEG4 or H.264, just the seriously lousy JPEG. I was given a quick "Use Firefox, it won't work in Safari" answer (which of course was bull), and when I kept up the inquiries they said they would look into it with the Mac in their office... which as of this writing was 2 weeks ago. It requires Java, but also must install an additional Trendnet-specific plug-in to work at all. Quality of the camera itself is very good. No way to allow casual guest access without a user/password. Has trouble saving settings on occasion. Loses wireless connectivity easily, just for the heck of it.I spent a lot of money on this camera, and to me it's useless. Nowhere, and I mean NOWHERE does their site or documentation say anything like "WILL NOT WORK FULLY ON A MAC". So if you have customers or users who have a Mac steer clear and get something else.

Reviews.Title: I recommend NOT to buy this camera.
Reviews.Author: Hernando Garcia P
Reviews.Content: The camera is aesthetically very well done, but that's it, why?- The micro SD memory never run into this camera, I always reported to me an error message "no one is inserted memory I have." I've factory resetted vces endless and always shows the same.- After 2 weeks installed in all recordings unbearable tinnitus can not hear what is happening in this conversation or hear the video.- Today the camera web server no longer allows me to access the camera, I think I must go back again to reboot the camera to factory parameters.- Configure the DDNS and works only the first time you update the IP address in the DDNS item, then never update it again, that is, if you turn off and on your router, the address does not change. In other words NO useless and a bad implementation of DDNS.- I had to factory reset the camera several times because when I make a change to any of the parameters the same, the camera simply records but the change does not work, try changing eg the mail recipient and even taking change, not the email sent to the new set.The image is decent if inside a house, but if you place it inside a porch overlooking your yard, too much light makes the image of false colors and image quality is lost in general .After I bought 3 cameras brand Airlive WN-200HD and I are but far better than this, everything works correctly, are completely stable, no crashes, DDNS is always updated, etc..The only good thing and so has a star, is that the manufacturer answer me and I agree that the camera is bad and accept change by warranty, so far I have not sent but soon I will.

ProductInfo.Features:
See more with Megapixel resolution up to 1280 x 800 (WXGA)
Pan 340 degree side-to-side and tilt 115 degree up-and-down
High speed wireless connection
Program motion detection recording;recording schedules;email alerts and more with complimentary software
2-way audio
ProductInfo.Name: TRENDnet Megapixel Wireless N Pan, Tilt, Zoom Network Surveillance Camera with 2-Way Audio, TV-IP672W (White)
